columns.text: This exercise requires us to determine the  effective annual interest rate.
**Effective Cost of Borrowing** or also known as effective interest rate is the rate of interest that a borrower actually pays on a loan.

Let's identify the given figures in the problem.


| | | 
|--|--:| 
|Quarterly Interest Rate | 0.75%| 
|Annual Interest Rate | 3%| 
| Compensating Balance| 5\%|

## Requirement a

In this requirement, the firm does not use the interest rate during the year, Hence, the effective annual interest rate is computed as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{EAR} &= \text{$(\text{1} +\dfrac{i}{n})^n$} - {\text{1}}\\[1pt]
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

EAR - Effective Annual Interest Rate

*i* -  Annual Interest Rate

*n* - Number of Periods

Now, we can compute the effective annual interest rate using the equation in step 4.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{EAR} &= \text{$(\text{1} +\dfrac{i}{n})^n$} - {\text{1}}\\[5pt]
&= \text{$(\text{1} +\dfrac{3\%}{4})^4$} - {\text{1}}\\[5pt]
&= \text{$(\text{1+0.0075})^4$} - {\text{1}}\\[5pt]
&= \text{$(\text{1.0075})^4$} - {\text{1}}\\[5pt]
&= \text{1.0303} - {\text{1}}\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{\textbf{0.0303 or 3.03\%}}
\end{aligned}$$

**Therefore, the effective annual interest rate is 3.03%.**

## Requirement b

In this requirement, the firm borrows $30 million immediately and repay it in one year. To compute the effective annual interest rate, first let's compute the **unused amount** by multiplying the difference between loan amount and borrowed amount by the percentage of compensating balance. 

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Unused Amount} &= \text{(Expected Loan - Actual Loan)} \times {\text{\% of Compensating Bal.}}\\[5pt]
 &= \text{(\$ 50,000,000 - 30,000,000)}  \times {\text{5\% }}\\[5pt]
 &= \text{\$ 20,000,000}  \times {\text{5\% }}\\[5pt]
&=\boxed{\text{\$ 1,000,000}}
\end{aligned}$$

Next, we will compute effective annual interest rate of $30,000,000.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{EAR on \$30,000,000} &= \text{$(\text{1 + i})^n$} - {\text{1}}\\[5pt]
&= \text{$(\text{1 + 1.65\%})^4$} - {\text{1}}\\[5pt]
&= \text{$(\text{1.0165})^4$} - {\text{1}}\\[5pt]
&= \text{1.0677} - {\text{1}}\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{\text{0.0677 or 6.77\%}}
\end{aligned}$$

Next, let's compute the proportion cost on non-interest bearing account by dividing the unused amount by the account loan.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Proportion Cost} &= \dfrac{\text{Unused Amount}}{\text{Actual Loan}}\\[10pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{\$\hspace{5pt}1,000,000}}{\text{\$ 30,000,000}}\\[10pt]
&=\boxed{\text{3.33\%}}\\
\end{aligned}$$

Next, let's compute the opportunity cost of non-interest bearing account by multiplying the effective annual interest rate during the year by the proportion cost.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Opportunity Cost} &= \text{EAR}\times{\text{Proportion Cost}}\\[5pt]
&= \text{3.03\%}\times{\text{3.33\%}}\\[5pt]
&=\boxed{0.10\%}\\
\end{aligned}$$

Lastly, we can now compute the effective annual interest rate for this requirement.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{EAR} &= \text{EAR on \$30,000,000} + {\text{Opportunity Cost}}\\[5pt]
&= \text{6.77\%} + {\text{0.10\%}}\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{\textbf{6.87\%}}
\end{aligned}$$

**Therefore, the effective annual interest rate is 6.87%.**

## Requirement c

In this requirement, the firm will borrow $50 million immediately and repay it in one year. Let's now compute the  effective annual interest rate.

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{EAR} &= \text{$(\text{1 + i})^n$} - {\text{1}}\\[5pt]
&= \text{$(\text{1 + 1.65\%})^4$} - {\text{1}}\\[5pt]
&= \text{$(\text{1.0165})^4$} - {\text{1}}\\[5pt]
&= \text{1.0677} - {\text{1}}\\[5pt]
&= \boxed{\textbf{0.0677 or 6.77\%}}
\end{aligned}$$

**Therefore, the effective annual interest rate is 6.77%.**
